If we modify the function to \\( z(t) = e^{i\\omega t + Bt}s \\) at a specific point, say \\( t = \\tau \\), where \\( B \\) is another constant, will \\( T[z](T) \\) at T solely depend on \\( A \\) regardless of \\( B \\)?
Explanation: With the introduction of an additional term \\( e^{Bt} \\) at \\( t = \\tau \\), the resulting function is altered from that point onwards. The transformed outcome \\( T[z](T) \\) depends on both \\( A \\) and \\( B \\) because the integral calculation will reflect the exponential influence of \\( B \\) added at \\( t = \\tau \\).
